snippet: 1932 Asset Management sold its 6.6 percent stake in the apparel company, which ousted its founder and chief executive.
abstract: Canadian firm 1832 Asset Management sells about 11.5 million shares of American Apparel stock, liquidating its entire holding in the company, even as retailer continues to battle with Lion Capital, one of its longtime lenders; is one of several firms to turn away from instability at American Apparel since board fired founder Dov Charney.
lead_paragraph: 1932 Asset Management sold its 6.6 percent stake in the apparel company, which ousted its founder and chief executive.

headline.main: Big Holder Gives Up Entire Stake in American Apparel
headline.print_headline: Big Holder Gives Up Entire Stake in Retailer
